rev.comment: Update on Google's partiality related to firearms. Can be verified by search for terms like "Ruger 10/22" or "Ruger Mark II" and not the ads that appear on the right.
rev.diff:
Line 183: Line 183:
===Partiality===
===Partiality===
In February 2003, Google banned the ads of [[Oceana (non-profit group)|Oceana]], a two-and-a-half-year-old non-profit organization, which was protesting the environmental effects of a major cruise ship operation's sewage treatment practices. Google claimed that their editorial policy states, "that Google does not accept advertising if the ad or site advocates against other individuals, groups, or organizations."
In February 2003, Google banned the ads of [[Oceana (non-profit group)|Oceana]], a two-and-a-half-year-old non-profit organization, which was protesting the environmental effects of a major cruise ship operation's sewage treatment practices. Google claimed that their editorial policy states, "that Google does not accept advertising if the ad or site advocates against other individuals, groups, or organizations."
  +   +
Google also has a policy about not accepting advertising (Adwords) from companies that sell firearm related products and have, at times, removed advertising such advertising from their web site (http://www.eguns.com/google/google.html) This is interesting because currently, firearm related advertsing from eBay and other companies does occur continuously. Google is obviously more partial to some companies than others.
===Offensive search results===
===Offensive search results===
